result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark E Green

records.addlTxt:
Information will be filed.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.

1:57 PM Prosecuting attorney Jedidiah J Dodge in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark E Green in court.  Attorney Anne Renc on behalf of Attorney Taylor Soule in court for Mark E Green. 
Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:03 AM Defendant Mark E Green in court.  Attorney Andrew Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Taylor O Soule in court for Mark E Green. 

Court calls case.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.

State requests warrant quashed.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant is quashed.
Bond is reinstated.

Matter will be adjourned.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Atty Pfeil makes statements to the court. 

BY THE COURT: Criminal warrant.  $500 cash alternative.
Initial Appearance set for June 27, 2022 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 2
No contact with J.B. or S.E.

1:02 PM Defendant Mark E Green appeared by video, in custody.  Atty Taylor Soule appears on behalf of the defendant.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Felony Bail Jumping and Theft - Movable Property. 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Court questions defendant. 

State requests a $1,500 signature bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule does not have any objections as to bond.
Hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
